poem:
**Echoes in the Quadrangle**

In shadows of ancient stone,  
where ivy whispers secrets,  
knowledge cloaked in dusk  
stirs whispers of unrest.  
Between panelled walls,  
wisdom and unease conspire—  
a dance of intellect,  
in the echo of hooves,  
cloven yet unseen,  
each step a reminder,  
of dark academia's touch  
on the soul's silent margins.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "And He Shall Appear by Kate van der Borgh review – enjoyable dark academia Will we ever wander an ancient quadrangle, enter an ivy-clad postern, or tiptoe into a panelled library again without feeling a tremor of disquiet? Dark academia is a booming genre, with only the cloven hooves of romantasy putting so much as a dent in its commercial dominance. But unlike its elven rival, dark academia has literary kudos, dating back to the hardcore classics". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
